edu.umass.cs.msocket

Interface MultipathInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    InternalMSocket, MSocket

    public interface MultipathInterface
    This class defines the interface for multipath operations
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Emmanuel Cecchet

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      FlowPath addFlowPath(SocketAddress binding)
      Add a flow path to the current connection.
      void bind(List<SocketAddress> bindings)
      Provides a list of IP:port that can be used by flow paths to bind locally.
      List<FlowPath> getActiveFlowPaths()
      Returns the list of currently active flow paths.
      List<SocketAddress> getBindings()
      Return the list of current IP:port used for binding new flow paths locally
      void migrateFlowPath(FlowPath flowpath, InetAddress localAddress, int localPort)
      Migrate a flowpath to the new local interface provided the new IP:port
      void removeFlowPath(FlowPath flowpath)
      Remove a flow path from the current connection
      void setFlowPathPolicy(MultipathPolicy policy)
      Defines the multipath policy to use when adding a new flowpath
      void setMaxFlowPath(int limit)
      Set the maximum number of flowpath allowed on this connection.

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        void bind(List<SocketAddress> bindings)
   throws IOException
        Provides a list of IP:port that can be used by flow paths to bind locally. Calling this method multiple times overwrites the values to be used for future flowpaths but it does not change the bindings of currently active flow paths.
        Parameters:
        bindings - list of IP:ports to pick from when creating a new flow path.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an error occurs

      • getBindings

        List<SocketAddress> getBindings()
        Return the list of current IP:port used for binding new flow paths locally
        Returns:
        list of currently defined bindings

      • addFlowPath

        FlowPath addFlowPath(SocketAddress binding)
        Add a flow path to the current connection. An eventual binding point can be provided to force a specific path to be taken.
        Parameters:
        binding - local IP:port to bind or null to use the currently defined list of bindings (if no binding is defined, the system will choose an interface automatically)
        Returns:
        a flowpath id or null if the limit of flowpaths has been reached

      • getActiveFlowPaths

        List<FlowPath> getActiveFlowPaths()
        Returns the list of currently active flow paths.
        Returns:
        a list of MSocket representing the different active flowpaths

      • removeFlowPath

        void removeFlowPath(FlowPath flowpath)
             throws IOException
        Remove a flow path from the current connection
        Parameters:
        flowpath - the flowpath to remove
        Throws:
        IOException - if the flowpath doesn't exist

      • setMaxFlowPath

        void setMaxFlowPath(int limit)
        Set the maximum number of flowpath allowed on this connection. The value must be at least 1.
        Parameters:
        limit - maximum number of flowpaths

      • setFlowPathPolicy

        void setFlowPathPolicy(MultipathPolicy policy)
        Defines the multipath policy to use when adding a new flowpath
        Parameters:
        policy - a policy from MultipathPolicy

      • migrateFlowPath

        void migrateFlowPath(FlowPath flowpath,
                     InetAddress localAddress,
                     int localPort)
        Migrate a flowpath to the new local interface provided the new IP:port
        Parameters:
        flowpath - the flowpath to migrate
        localAddress - new local address to bind the listening socket
        localPort - new local port to bind the listening socket
